revised_title: A Review of Ship Structures and Materials Development in the 1970s
tldr: This article discusses the advancements in ship structures and materials during the 1970s. It highlights the emergence of a more scientific basis for ship structural design, the development of new ship types and sizes, and the increasing knowledge of ocean environments and their effects on ship structures. The article also explores the progress made in predicting load actions, structural responses, and the design process, as well as the challenges that still need to be addressed.
